I bought this app a few years ago and it suddenly malfunctioned and wouldn't let me in. Now I have deleted it and downloaded it again but don't know how to pick up from where I left to include my paid version. I can provide a copy of my receipt. Please help.
This app is absolutely extraordinary its great

I love this app! We homeschool and I have always had a hard time teaching my kids algebra. While this game doesn't cover everything, the core concepts became very clear and easy to apply after using it. I wish there were more games like this!

Each play in the game uses pictures to represent numbers. It doesnt make sense unless you already know what the moves represent. Like a frog on top of a frog, and you slide them together to create something that looks like an egg. That represents creating a whole number from a fraction, creating 1 from 2/2. But you wouldn't know that just from playing the game. Maybe in conjunction with school lessons, it might have some value.

Great game! The price is TOTES worth it! It is hard to beleive that it teaches algebra! My little sisters LOVE it! If you or one of your kids hate (learning) algebra this app is pertect for you! Get this app!
replyContent: Have kids loving to learn algebra is what we are aiming for :-)! Thank you for sharing your learning experience with DragonBox Algebra!

content: the game is cropped on OnePlus 7 pro. the game sims zoomed in and lower resolution.
love it. played it through during the summer because my teacher did a bad job of explaining algebra. This is wonderful and introduces it as a game and slowly switches to letters and numbers.

I've played the game for about an hour or so. My rating isn't a reflection of the quality of the app, but more so a reflection of it not suiting my learning style. I don't really like the little pictures, I much prefer just numbers and algebraic letters, it confused me to a point where equations I could solve outside of this app, I got confused on. Lastly, it's an issue for my learning style...I'm more of a need to know learner. this game explains your specials but not actual rules to algebra.
Fantastic.

I love that this app takes the math out of algebra! Instead, it focuses on teaching the concepts in a way that bypasses the student's fear of the topic. It gamefies the concepts so students learn algebra the same way they learn other games.
Great for kids but not only ;)
Wish I had this back in my day - I've learnt more doing this now with my daughter than I learned in school over that 4 or 5 years on how to rearrange equations

I'm enrolled in computer science after being out of school for 12 years, I bombed my math placement test and was going to need to take developmental courses to get back on track. I wanted to give the placement test another shot and was looking for study aids when I came across this app, there were a lot of good reviews and I figured it was worth a try for a few bucks and I just have to say wow! This app is an amazing learning tool, it helped me understand algebra in a way I never learned in school. I spent an evening with the game, it only took a few hours to get through, I then took a random math test to re-familiarize myself with terminology and non-algebraic stuff. I took the placement test again and this time tested right into the class I need! This is an incredible app and I really can't say enough about it, I wish I had grown up at a time where tools like this were available.
Just a fantastic way to learn algebra. Totally engaging. One note is there's very little reason for the 5+ to exist. The 12+ starts in the same place, it just has more levels.
Best $8 spent ever.
So amazing. I love it!
Learning maths can be fun
Fun for kids and adults. Teaches algebra concepts painlessly.
Awesome game!   The kids don't even know that they are doing Algebra.
Bought just to see what it's about. This is the new paradigm of teaching. Brilliant.
Clever use of gaming for learning. I wish more computer based learning could be this innovative.  It is a lot of fun, & children love it.

I had fun with this but my 4 year old is obsessed with this game. Of course, he has no idea what he's doing and for the harder levels, he just watched the playback... But he scoffs at the easy ones on Side B now. You've made a great game! We'd love some more worlds to go through.

It's good but think should do characters to start with.  Can see what your thought process is introducing people into algebra, but alpha numeric would be good a bit more early on. This app, brilliant idea.
Great. But needs printable algebra worksheets to go with each level.
I am 27, getting certified as a secondary math teacher. I have so much fun with this app.

I have worked as an adult educator and with year 9 to 12 maths students. This is an exceptional app for teaching and learning transposition.  The free version can be used as the best homework ever.  Graphical and clever, it makes the learning fun.  A puzzle with carefully introduced tools.  More importantly it teaches algebra how students learn algebra, building on their basic understanding of shapes and objects, and how they relate to formulas student's intuitively use (rather than the annoying context teaching).  Pros: Beautiful Progressive with simple steps Free  Cons: Can't see any

The game is broken. It prompts you for feedback after each level, even if you already answered. And then the feedback prompt leaves behind artifacts in the game. This is a paid app, and not cheap one. It shouldn't have annoying popups.
Playing as old lady. Enjoying!
Love it but giving 1 star for constant review requests.
A great way to get into algebra!

The objective is to isolate the box. I isolate the box and then it says "yuck" about an aspect of how I isolated the box. But it doesn't explain why it's "yuck"? I isolated the box as it said so why do I get a yuck? Should the objective be changed to isolate the box in the best way or something? What's the best way ? The game doesn't explain that. Lost with maths again.
Waste of money

Great game! My nephew (age 6) loves it

I'm not giving 5 stars though because after each world I beat a pop up asks if I want to leave feedback and no matter how I answer the pop up doesn't go away and blocks me from being able to see the game as I play unless I exit completely and then go back in.
Awesome app! When do we get dragon box calculus???
This app changed my whole concept of algebra! An absolutely brilliant app and if they made another, I'd but it.
Best algebra app on the market

My son asked why this is called "DragonBox Algebra," because "I thought algebra was math?", he said. Lol! I said, "It is math!" He still doesn't believe me though. I only gave four stars because I haven't actually tried it yet. But, I will update my rating once I give it a try. Also, my only real complaint at the moment, is that it costs $8.62 on Google Play, I think it was cheaper on my son's Windows Tablet. Update: AWESOME app, still giving 4 *, because $8.62 is still pricey!
I had fun but I finished it in one evening. I wish it had 100 levels

Chapter 5 level 1is very weird. I cannot still making progress after this.
It is more like a game, and dosnt actually help with algebra. I wish I could get a refund. :( :-[
I learned algebra without even knowing that i was. Then the terms started to look familiar and i thought"wait a second this is algebra? Awesome!"

Very intuitive and easy to learn. Kids will easily think it's just a game. The trick to applying this is to paper is to actually remember the automatic processes the game does for you. Worth the purchase!
Best educational app ever!

I LOVE algebra (always have), but found this game frustrated others around 10th level because there was no WRITTEN explanation such as Order of Operations (PEMDAS) so they only "passed" a level through trial and error.

Great way to teach kids the patterns and rules of algebra.  To improve it even more,  you could add more levels between learning new powers, and add a problem creator tool to create and solve new problems.

It's great and only takes a few days to finish at max. I was wondering if you could create a new game for early calculus (derivatives, integration, differential)? The reason I ask this is because I'm 14 and have been doing HSC work, but haven't been able to find anything that can teach me it like a game, it would be awesome. Derivatives and anti derivatives are probably the easiest to teach and make a game out of similar to this one. Could be ages 16+ , I would really appreciate it

By far one of the best games/learning tools of our era...Getting into the game is easy for anyone of any ages; if you think you're above using dragons and crickets to gain a firm understanding of algebra....go back to crushing jelly beans and candy wrappers I guess...This games simple, yet elegant abstraction of algebra quickly leaves you doing real equations in under 2-3 sittings with ease. The game also challenges you to make the fewest moves possible; encouraging good practices for verbosity. Get this!
Best game EVER

i am 42 but didn't do algebra. so i completed all levels of 12+ dragon box. i still don't know what i was doing 90% of the time and have no idea how to apply it to an algebra sum on paper. :-/ great fun and i would still recommend it for kids who might be learning algebra at same time so may make more sense.
replyContent: Hello ila ila, have you tried to Side B section ? That's the area where you practice on paper looking equations. That should take you one step closer. As for the final step, please look at our online resources http://wewanttoknow.com/teachers/ in particular, the teacher manual and the worksheets. Good luck!

content: And my kid actually plays it...which means he now understands basic and even not-so-basic algebra concepts. Brilliant! A+

I hope I'm learning algebra. I love this game. I started playing it to re-introduce myself to math in a fun way after 25 years of not doing any math.  I need to pass the GRE.  I'm almost done with all the extras in the game now. Dear DragonBox,  please make more games. Otherwise, how will I spend my random free moments ... A few more glowing comments: Pleasantly hypnotic tunes, melodies change up with each challenge; Cool sound effects, symbols/ characters that are simultaneously cute and fierce, rich graphics. Altogether stellar.
Is there a classroom version?   I can't afford this for each student. ..I'd love to test in classroom
Amazing

i heard good things but its alot of useless fluff, on chap 2 and didnt get to any algebra yet just matching tiles to feed a egg, nothing saying if and when i can learn algebra 9 dollars for this? refund
replyContent: Jennifer, sorry you feel like that.  The game was designed for young people, hence the graphical approach. Yet from chap 1 level 1 everything in the game is algebra. We use shapes instead of letters/digits, that's all. The 'x' appears end of chapter 2 so I would recommend to try it a bit more! Take contact if you still want a refund! Thanks!

content: My only complaint is that I keep finishing levels in 1 to 3 moves under the required amount,  it takes the fun out of it because it feels too easy. EDIT: In chapter 10 level 7 I can easily make 1 = 0 using the powers and to me that is really really bad and with a flaw like this it will just confuse students way more than it helps. This flaw knocked 3 stars off my rating and I wish I could give 0 stars until the powers reflect real operations.
replyContent: Hello Monty, thanks for the feedback! This particular 1=0 'bug' is by design. Here's our support page on why it works that way: http://support.dragonboxapp.com/knowledgebase/articles/198511-bug-math-contradictions As for finishing the levels with fewer moves, kids usually do not. The game was designed for kids, not teachers or parents! Thanks!

content: I like the app! Seems to get at some reasonably fear-inducing symbol-manipulation skills in a non-threatening way. The big thing that I think is missing is a way to practice without the game forcing you to only make alegbraically correct moves. For example, there is no way to accidentally add a quantity to only one side of the equation. Would love to see a more challenging mode where that is possible--that would be better proof that students are learning things deeply.
replyContent: Hei Evan, thanks for the feedback. We know that this is one of the most requested features. We haven't yet completed it. A bit sad to see that this cost us 2 stars though! :)

content: The only suggestions are about the solution playback. You could have a parent account, or code, so the full solutions can only be played if the kid asks their parents/teacher. Also keep track of whether the solution was played or not (eg extra star if no solution played). Also the solutions could be played in small sections, so if you only play a little bit of it to get unstuck you get more recognition that if you just play the whole thing. At the end give bonuses for less sections played.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback cameron! We'll keep it in mind.

content: One can get to 0 equal 1, which is not a good thing, by dividing by (1-1). Moreover, suggestions : 1/ one should be able to drag a denominator to the other side triggering multiplication by the denominator on both sides, and vanishing of the dragged value. 2/ No need for both boxing and bubbling,  bubbling should be enough,  dragging a bubble to the bottom deck should let you add it here for later use. Otherwise, wonderful. Hopefully the next generation interface for Maxima/Sage. Congratulations.
replyContent: Pablo, with regard to 1==0, see http://support.dragonboxapp.com/knowledgebase/articles/198511-bug-math-contradictions, as for your suggestions thanks! We will evaluate them. Note that for #2, boxing allows to select a subset of a group, something you cannot do with bubbles.

I'm not really a game player, but I wanted to check out Dragonbox's claims regarding algebra and learning.  So, I bought the app and then proceeded to play through all 10 chapters (about 200 math challenges).   I think the game is great for getting students to work on the basics of expression simplification and equation solving.  If you are learning order of operations, properties of numbers (like associative and commutative) and properties of equality, then the game helps you to practice the skills.    I'm looking forward to the version that forces you to use Properties of Exponents, Fractional exponents and logarithms!
Super fun and actually has some quite nifty little challenges at the later levels. A must for both kids and adults.
Cool
Cool game!
I have never seen a math game anything like this. It is exceptional.
Excellent game to give your brain a workout

OK, it just wasn't clear from the website if the learning curve was easier for the 5+ version. I'll be getting it too (my 5yo finished world 1 of 12+, but the curve is a bit too steep for fun). I finished 8 worlds so far of 12+. Great game! Wishing for more advanced math!
replyContent: Ian, the dragonboxapp.com site contains a list of the difference in content. The 5+ game is shorter, and the learning curve is easier as well. You can watch the game walkthroughs online on YouTube for a better idea. Feel free to contact us for more info.
